Text: Out of Office AutoReply Master Netting Agreement AssignmentsI will probably be out of the office until November In case of urgent matters please contact my assistant Nicole Halevi

EnBW Default Cc signed and returned our meeting summary the draft of which was sent to you by email dated March EnBW has also accepted our invoices for damages for January and February as attached We are expecting payment within the next days Presently EnBW is supplying us with MW at the SwissItalian border until the end of March I have been informed by EnBW that they are also negotiating for transmission of MW for the remainder of the year to the SwissItalian border We will be informed early next week of the results of these negotiations Michael
Re EnBW Defaultin preparation of our discussion I would like to send you a draft of the type of letter we would like to send to EnBW this week I will be calling at hours London time Regards Michael

EnBW Default Cc up on our conversation earlier this week I would like to inform you as to where we presently are I will send you tomorrow by fax copies of the Master Agreement Transaction Agreement and all written communication between EnBW and our traders You will also receive a draft of the letter that we are intending to send out on Friday as well as a memorandum on the underlying issues as prepared by outside counsel I would then like to arrange for us to go over this preliminary analysis before we send out the letter on Friday Regards Michael
EnBWattached please find the english version of the letter to be sent out tomorrow as well as the enclosures to that letter Later today you can also reach me on my mobile phone at Regards Michael

EnBW Default Preliminary Analysis by Local Counsel Cc find attached the analysis provided by Pnder regarding the underlying issues in the EnBW default which we have discussed in connection with the letter sent out February This memo serves to identify the facts we need to establish more thoroughly as well as a preliminary overview of our causes of action and the likelihood of prevailing Over the next two weeks we will be preparing a more detailed analysis Regards Michael

EnBW Cc translations of the various letters sent between Enron and EnBW since our claim for damages dated February EnBW response dated February Addtional EnBW response dated February Our response sent February refusing delivery at alternative delivery point for lack of sufficient transmission capacity and invitation to meet on March EnBW response accepting invitation dated February We are in the process of reviewing all telephone conversations emails and facsimiles between Enron and EnBW since June up to February in order to establish the meaning and construction of the Force Majeure Clause in the Master Agreement and theTerms and Conditions of the Transaction Agreement This review is structured along the attached checklist and conducted today by outside counsel in our London offices We will prepare a report and risk analysis in preparation of the meeting with EnBW on March Michael

EnBW Cc find the draft letter we sent to EnBW end of last week summarizing our meeting we had with EnBW on March We are expecting EnBW to contact us this week to inform us about their progress regarding the network operator that defaulted on EnBW with regard to the Transaction Agreement between Enron and EnBW Regards Michael
